item.title: Stat Spotlight: Eviction Filings Are Soaring in Oklahoma County
item.description: Figure 1: Eviction filings are on the rise. Eviction filings across the state have been rising steadily since the onset of the COVID-19 Pandemic, despite eviction moratoriums and assistance programs aimed at preventing people from losing their homes due to the crisis. In Oklahoma County in particular, though, it seems that the dam may have finally broken – in February of 2022, Oklahoma County landlords filed 2,188 eviction cases, which is more than any month on record.

item.title: Data Deep Dive: Oklahoma County Detention Center
item.description: 1. The Oklahoma County Detention Center Located in Oklahoma City, the Oklahoma County Detention Center (OCDC) is the biggest jail in the state, currently incarcerating an average of around 1,500-1,600 people. It used to be much bigger – in 2016, the jail’s population peaked at over 2,500 people, X% the jail’s original intended capacity – but reform efforts undertaken in the last few years have successfully begun to reverse this upward trend.

item.title: About Open Justice Oklahoma
item.description: Our Mission # My name is Radek and I’m the author of this theme. I made it to help you present your ideas easier. We all know how hard is to start something on the web, especially these days. You need to prepare a bunch of stuff, configure them and when that’s done — create the content. This theme is pretty basic and covers all of the essentials. All you have to do is start typing!

item.title: OJO Research Team
item.description: Ryan Gentzler – Research Director # Ryan Gentzler is the Director of Open Justice Oklahoma. For over two years, Ryan served as a Policy Analyst focused on criminal justice at Oklahoma Policy Institute, where he was responsible for research on topics including sentencing, incarceration, court fines and fees, and pretrial detention. Open Justice Oklahoma grew out of Ryan’s groundbreaking analysis of court records, which was used to inform critical policy debates.
